content.body: annevk: ping on https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/pull/1737 when you get the chance
content.formatted_body: annevk: ping on https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/pull/1737 when you get the chance

content.body: zcorpan: Are you aware of any particular sites/cases for which the firing order of `textInput` and `beforeinput` is a problem?
content.formatted_body: zcorpan: Are you aware of any particular sites/cases for which the firing order of textInput and beforeinput is a problem?

content.body: Or short of that, do you have an idea of what possible problems it might cause?
I’m not questioning that we should have interop on it. I’m just hoping to get a sense of the developer story around it — what problems/pain it causes for developers

sideshowbarker: not aware of any instances of problems for textInput specifically, but recall seeing complaints about the lack of interop in event order generally is a pain. e.g. https://youtu.be/1bZYmpOOC8U?si=tVeWBiVbwAnRpvPt&t=392 for focusout/blur/focusin/focus order
content.formatted_body: sideshowbarker: not aware of any instances of problems for textInput specifically, but recall seeing complaints about the lack of interop in event order generally is a pain. e.g. https://youtu.be/1bZYmpOOC8U?si=tVeWBiVbwAnRpvPt&t=392 for focusout/blur/focusin/focus order

content.body: jQuery overriding it (until v4) is telling

annevk: The interop situation here is pretty sad: https://hsivonen.fi/idn.html when trying to see which URLs the browsers try to fetch. (Note that those URLs don't go to working server setup.) It seems to me that Safari is the closest to the spec, Firefox enforces the bidi rule on a per-label basis instead of whole-name basis, Chrome is just weird.
content.formatted_body: annevk: The interop situation here is pretty sad: https://hsivonen.fi/idn.html when trying to see which URLs the browsers try to fetch. (Note that those URLs don't go to working server setup.) It seems to me that Safari is the closest to the spec, Firefox enforces the bidi rule on a per-label basis instead of whole-name basis, Chrome is just weird.

content.body: Those host names do have DNS entries, though.
